00088             UINT32  m_allocations;

00103                                              size_t newsize, BOOLEAN shallcopy);

00203         // the root page which contains the description of a page
00204         struct Page {
00205             BOOLEAN      m_ishuge;
00206 #if defined(APOXI_HEAP_NAME_USAGE)
00207             CHAR *       m_name;
00208 #endif

00210             UINT16       m_low;
00211             UINT32       m_high;

00214             UINT           m_N;
00215             const FctTable *   m_fct_table;
00216             Page *       m_page;
00217         };

00250     #define BLOCK_HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR(name, size, high)        static UINT16 m_size_vector_##name[(size / high)+1];
00251     #define VAR_HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize)     static UINT32 m_size_vector_##name[(size / blocksize)+1];
00252     #define HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR_PTR(name)                      m_size_vector_##name,
00253 #else
00254     #define BLOCK_HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR(name, size, high)    
00255     #define VAR_HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize) 
00256     #define HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR_PTR(name)  
00257 #endif

00260 #if defined(APOXI_HEAP_CONTEXT_USAGE)
00261     #define BLOCK_HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR(name, size, high)     static HeapVector::ContextId m_context_vector_##name[(size / high)+1];
00262     #define VAR_HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize)  static HeapVector::ContextId m_context_vector_##name[(size / blocksize)+1];
00263     #define HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR_PTR(name)                   m_context_vector_##name,
00264 #else
00265     #define BLOCK_HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR(name, size, high)     
00266     #define VAR_HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize)  
00267     #define HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR_PTR(name)                   
00268 #endif

00273     #define APOXI_HEAP_NAME_PTR(name)   m_name_##name,
00274 #else
00275     #define APOXI_HEAP_NAME(name)    
00276     #define APOXI_HEAP_NAME_PTR(name)   
00277 #endif

00279 // constant of the additional size per blockpage for memory checking
00280 #if defined(APOXI_HEAP_MEM_ACCESS_CHECK)
00281     // dont change that values !!!!!
00282     #define NO_CHECK_BYTES 4
00283 #else
00284     #define NO_CHECK_BYTES 0
00285 #endif
00286 
00287  
00289 //
00290 //  BLOCK_HEAP_PAGE(name, size, low, high)
00291 //
00293 /* Configuration:
00294     name: name of the page
00295     size: overall size of the memorypool, for C166 shall be smaller then < 16K
00296     low:  elements which are greater equal than low can be held by this page
00297     high: elements which are less equal than high can be held by this page
00298           ATTENTION: high must be a multiple of 2 it represents also the blocksize.
00299 
00300     Example:
00301         BLOCK_HEAP_PAGE(page_10, 10*1024,9,10);
00302     will allocate a 10 K page where elements between 9 and 10 bytes can be held.
00303     1024 blocks can be used.
00304 */
00305 
00306 
00307 #define BLOCK_HEAP_PAGE(name, size, low, high)                          \
00308 const UINT c_add_bytes_##name = ((size / high)+1) * NO_CHECK_BYTES;     \
00309 static UINT m_mem_##name[(size+c_add_bytes_##name)/HEAP_BYTES_PER_UINT];\
00310 static UINT m_bits_##name[(size / high / HeapVector::BITS_PER_UINT)+1]; \
00311 APOXI_HEAP_NAME(name)                                                   \
00312 BLOCK_HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR(name, size, high)                                \
00313 BLOCK_HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR(name, size, high)                             \
00314 static HeapVector::BlockPage m_page_##name = {                          \
00315     (UINT8 *)&m_mem_##name[0],                                          \
00316     m_bits_##name,                                                      \
00317     0,                                                                  \
00318     HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR_PTR(name)                                          \
00319     HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR_PTR(name)                                       \
00320     TRUE                                                                \
00321     HEAP_STAT_STRUCT_VALUES                                             \
00322 };                                                                      \
00323 static const HeapVector::Page name = {                                  \
00324     FALSE,                                                              \
00325     APOXI_HEAP_NAME_PTR(name)                                           \
00326     high,                                                               \
00327     low,                                                                \
00328     high,                                                               \
00329     (UINT8 *)&m_mem_##name[0],                                          \
00330     ((UINT8 *)&m_mem_##name[0])+size+c_add_bytes_##name,                \
00331     size / high,                                                        \
00332     &g_fcts_block_page,                                                 \
00333     (HeapVector::Page*)&m_page_##name                                   \
00334 };
00335 
00337 //
00338 //  VAR_HEAP_PAGE(name, size, blocksize, min, max)
00339 //
00341 /* Configuration:
00342     name: name of the page
00343     size: overall size of the memorypool, for C166 shall be smaller then < 16K
00344     blocksize: used blocksize for the page, ATTENTION: must be a value 2^N, 
00345                like 4, 8, 16, 32, 64 etc ... reason for that is faster divison, 
00346                through bit shift operation
00347     min:  elements which are greater equal than low can be held by this page
00348     max: elements which are less equal than high can be held by this page, this
00349           value has to be also smaller then the size of the pool
00350     
00351     This page is using a best fit algorithm, if a request wants to allocate blocks, 
00352     the best position will be found to avoid fragmentation throughout the blocklist.
00353     That means in the case:
00354         5 free, 3 used, 2 free, 4 used ...
00355     allocating of 2 blocks will result in
00356         5 free, 3 used, 2 used, 4 used 
00357 
00358     Example:
00359         VAR_HEAP_PAGE(page_d1, 64*127,64,64,1024); 
00360     will allocate 8128 bytes, with a blocksize of 64 bytes where elements between 
00361     64 and 1024 bytes can be held. If 100 bytes shall be allocated 2 blocks have to
00362     be used etc. 
00363 
00364 */
00365 
00366 #define VAR_HEAP_PAGE(name, size, blocksize, low, high)                 \
00367 static UINT   m_mem_##name[(size/HEAP_BYTES_PER_UINT)];                 \
00368 static UINT16 m_length_##name[(size / blocksize)+1];                    \
00369 APOXI_HEAP_NAME(name)                                                   \
00370 VAR_HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize)                             \
00371 VAR_HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize)                          \
00372 static HeapVector::VarPage m_page_##name = {                            \
00373     (UINT8 *)&m_mem_##name[0],                                          \
00374     0,                                                                  \
00375     0,                                                                  \
00376     m_length_##name,                                                    \
00377     0,                                                                  \
00378     HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR_PTR(name)                                          \
00379     HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR_PTR(name)                                       \
00380     TRUE                                                                \
00381     HEAP_STAT_STRUCT_VALUES                                             \
00382 };                                                                      \
00383 static const HeapVector::Page name = {                                  \
00384     FALSE,                                                              \
00385     APOXI_HEAP_NAME_PTR(name)                                           \
00386     blocksize,                                                          \
00387     low,                                                                \
00388     high,                                                               \
00389     (UINT8 *)&m_mem_##name[0],                                          \
00390     ((UINT8 *)&m_mem_##name[0])+size,                                   \
00391     size / blocksize,                                                   \
00392     &g_fcts_var_page,                                                   \
00393     (HeapVector::Page*)&m_page_##name                                   \
00394 };
00395 
00397 //
00398 //  HUGE_HEAP_PAGE(name, size, blocksize, min, max)
00399 //
00401 /* Configuration:
00402     see VAR_HEAP_PAGE but with HUGE memory model
00403 */
00404 
00405 #define HUGE_HEAP_PAGE(name, size, blocksize, low, high)                \
00406 static UINT HUGE m_mem_##name[((size+blocksize)/HEAP_BYTES_PER_UINT)];  \
00407 static UINT16 m_length_##name[(size/blocksize)+1];                      \
00408 APOXI_HEAP_NAME(name)                                                   \
00409 VAR_HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize)                             \
00410 VAR_HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR(name, size, blocksize)                          \
00411 static HeapVector::VarPage m_page_##name = {                            \
00412     0,                                                                  \
00413     (UINT8 HUGE *)&m_mem_##name[0],                                     \
00414     ((UINT8 HUGE *)&m_mem_##name[0])+size,                              \
00415     m_length_##name,                                                    \
00416     0,                                                                  \
00417     HEAP_SIZE_VECTOR_PTR(name)                                          \
00418     HEAP_CONTEXT_VECTOR_PTR(name)                                       \
00419     TRUE                                                                \
00420     HEAP_STAT_STRUCT_VALUES                                             \
00421 };                                                                      \
00422 static const HeapVector::Page name = {                                  \
00423     TRUE,                                                               \
00424     APOXI_HEAP_NAME_PTR(name)                                           \
00425     blocksize,                                                          \
00426     low,                                                                \
00427     high,                                                               \
00428     0,                                                                  \
00429     0,                                                                  \
00430     size / blocksize,                                                   \
00431     &g_fcts_huge_page,                                                  \
00432     (HeapVector::Page*)&m_page_##name                                   \
00433 };
00434

00437 #define PAGE_TABLE_BEGIN(heapname)  static HeapVector::Page * m_pages_##heapname[] = {
00438 #define PAGE_ENTRY(name) (HeapVector::Page*)& name, 
00439 #define PAGE_TABLE_END 0 };
00440 
00441 
00442 #define HEAP_TABLE_BEGIN()  static HeapVector::HeapTableEntry m_heap_table[] = {
00443 
00444 #define HEAP_ENTRY(heapname, id)  {                                     \
00445     (HeapVector::Page**)(HeapVector::Page*)& m_pages_##heapname[0],     \
00446     id,                                                                 \
00447     id,                                                                 \
00448     0,                                                                  \
00449     0,                                                                  \
00450     #heapname                                                           \
00451 },
00452 
00453 #define VIRTUAL_HEAP_ENTRY(heapname, id, virtid, size)  {               \
00454     (HeapVector::Page**)(HeapVector::Page*)& m_pages_##heapname[0],     \
00455     id,                                                                 \
00456     virtid,                                                             \
00457     size,                                                               \
00458     0,                                                                  \
00459     #heapname                                                           \
00460 },
00461 #define HEAP_TABLE_END { 0, 0 } };
